analyzeResult.content:
November 26, 1984
TO: Mr. G. W. McKenna .
Re: WINSTON November Performance Review
1. Share Performance
A. September Month SOM
WINSTON's September share of 14.29% is 1.03 share points ahead of Plan with all styles performing above Plan except Ultra Lights 85's ( -. 01). This share level is, however, somewhat overstated due to heavy loading in late September. WINSTON's load was approximately 1,850MM units, was national in scope and included all styles except the Ultra Lights styles.
- Versus September, 1983, total WINSTON's SOM increased 1.45 points',' with gains recorded on all styles. This share increase is also overstated due to the September load.
- Versus the August, 1984 SOM of 11.89%, WINSTON's SOM increased 2.40
points, again primarily reflecting the September load. September Month SOM

B. September Quarter SOM
1. National September Quarter SOM
Total WINSTON is .61 share points ahead of Plan and .56 points ahead of September Quarter, 1983, with gains on all styles versus Plan and YAG. Gains are overstated due to heavier loading in September
Quarter, 1984 versus YAG. September Quarter SOM

*Revised Plan issued 10/5/84.
WINSTON's 1984 YTD performance continues to show a substantially reduced decline rate versus the peak loss period experienced in 1983. Total September, 1984 YTD SOM is 11.70%, down only .02 points versus YAG. By comparison, the SOM decline in September, 1983 YTD versus YAG was 1.35 points.
2. Sales Area September Quarter SOM
WINSTON's national share gain versus YAG was paralleled by gains in all sales areas. The greatest SOM increases versus YAG occurred in WINSTON's strongest sales areas where Brand spending has been concentrated in 1984: South Atlantic, North Central and Mid-Continent.

paragraphs.content: WINSTON's September share of 14.29% is 1.03 share points ahead of Plan with all styles performing above Plan except Ultra Lights 85's ( -. 01). This share level is, however, somewhat overstated due to heavy loading in late September. WINSTON's load was approximately 1,850MM units, was national in scope and included all styles except the Ultra Lights styles.
- Versus September, 1983, total WINSTON's SOM increased 1.45 points',' with gains recorded on all styles. This share increase is also overstated due to the September load.
- Versus the August, 1984 SOM of 11.89%, WINSTON's SOM increased 2.40
primarily reflecting the September load. September Month SOM
Total WINSTON is .61 share points ahead of Plan and .56 points ahead of September Quarter, 1983, with gains on all styles versus Plan and YAG. Gains are overstated due to heavier loading in September

WINSTON's 1984 YTD performance continues to show a substantially reduced decline rate versus the peak loss period experienced in 1983. Total September, 1984 YTD SOM is 11.70%, down only .02 points versus YAG. By comparison, the SOM decline in September, 1983 YTD versus YAG was 1.35 points.

WINSTON's national share gain versus YAG was paralleled by gains in all sales areas. The greatest SOM increases versus YAG occurred in WINSTON's strongest sales areas where Brand spending has been concentrated in 1984: South Atlantic, North Central and Mid-Continent.
